Description.val:
FY21 funding increase is due to Virginia Class Acoustic Superiority hull cladding funds provided to Naval Shipyards for design and procurement of an environmental enclosure with integrated gantry crane (~$18.2M) appropriate for NSY drydocks; procurement of additional handling equipment, lifting fixtures, & acoustic adhesive processing equipment; and installation planning, sequencing & scheduling (~$5.7M). The $23.9M increase is offset by a 1.85M decrease in non-recurring engineering expenses for a net increase of $22M.  See [P3A / PB002 VA Acoustic Superiority] Footnote (16) for further detail.

The Submarine Support Equipment budget provides for equipment technical refresh and upgrades that consist of hardware, software, system engineering, integrated logistics support, system test and evaluation, training, data, alteration installation teams and program management. This funding also procures equipment and material used to implement the military high priority Submarine Silencing Program for operating nuclear submarines. These silencing program equipment technical refreshes and upgrades are not supported by other NAVSEA program offices and support SSN/SSBN/SSGN Class submarines and land based laboratories/facilities. As the VIRGINIA Class submarine program matures and more submarines enter the operational and sustainment phase of the lifecycle, Navy leadership made a decision to transfer funds for modernization and maintenance upgrades and obsolete equipment replacement from new construction program to the Submarine Support Equipment account for these items to be executed on operational VA class submarines.

The installation funds are provided for the Ship Service Turbine Generator (SSTG) Governors on SSN688 and SSN21 Class submarines, acoustic range array replacement, Ship Control System Processors for SEAWOLF Class submarines, and SSN Class Component Upgrades.

Funding for modifications and improvements to SSN 688, SSBN 726 and SSN 21 classes Attack and Ballistic Missile Submarine weapons launching, stowage and shipping systems, torpedo tube system components and torpedo tube test equipment. These requirements arise as a result of the introduction of new or modified weapons, devices, and sensors and their subsequent evaluation test and operational use. Also procured are reliability, maintainability, functional and safety modifications and tactical improvements resulting from operational use experience. This funding also provides management services required for installations.


[P40A / SSTG Digital Voltage]: SSTG Digital Voltage Regulator upgrade (SHIPALT 4884K) - 
Existing SSTGs on early VA Class submarines have analog voltage regulators, which are obsolete and unsustainable. SSN 780 and later ships were delivered with the new design Digital Voltage Regulator. A backfit SHIPALT has been developed to replace the analog voltage regulators on SSN 774-779 with the new digital design, targeted to begin in FY18. This effort began under budget line item 0942 and has transitioned to 0941 beginning in FY18 where the remaining shipsets will be procured and installed.

[P40A / ICS Block 1 & 2 Design Change]: Integrated Communications System (ICS) Block 1 & 2 and Block 5 - The interior Integrated Communication System installation on VA Class ships Block 1 & 2 hulls is a COTS based system designed in the mid-1990s and first installed in 2002. Much of the design is now obsolete and unsupported. The ICS must be operational to meet underway requirements. To resolve current parts obsolescence, procurement and backfit of key replacement components (example, processor cards, graphics cards, Asynchronous Transfer Mode switches, Linear Displacement Transducers) on Block 1 & 2 platforms is required to ensure continued operation in the near term. This effort began in line item 0942 and transitioned to 0941 in FY18. To address continuing future obsolescence of the ICS, a system redesign and replacement via SHIPALT is required. SHIPALT development leveraging the Block 5 ICS design will commence in FY19 with procurements and installs in following years.

[P40A / Bulkhead 6 Tile Maintenance SA 4563K]: Bulkhead 6 Tile Replacement (SHIPALT 4563K) modifies the Bulkhead 6 damping tile arrangement and tile design in the Main Ballast Tank to facilitate required recurring maintenance including, ultrasonic hull inspection efforts, eliminating the need to remove/replace the attached damping tiles during scheduled availabilities, which is a significant cost and schedule savings during planned depot availabilities. This effort began under budget line item 0942 and has transitioned to 0941 beginning in FY18 where the remaining four of five shipsets will be procured and all five will be installed.

[P40A / DGIOTS Shock Modification SA 4776K]: Diesel Generator Independent Over Speed Trip System (DGIOTS) Shock Modification (SHIPALT 4778K) - The DGIOTS control panel on VA Class Blocks I/II has obsolete components and fails to meet requirements for shock and vibration. SHIPALT 4778K provides a shock/vibration-qualified control panel using current, supportable technology. Backfit installation of the SHIPALT is planned for 14 ships). Material lead time is less than 12 months.

[P40A / Fwd Automatic Bus Transfer Pwr Mod]: SSN Class Component Upgrades - Forward ABT Power Modification - The in-service VA ships in Block I/II have received the Hotel Services SHIPALT which included Static ABTs and power transformers to support increased forward electronics processing capability for continuing SWFTS sonar/fire control tech insertions. At-sea operations have since identified problems with loss of electronics processing in conjunction with a loss of power to a forward electrical bus. A new construction change for blocks III/IV platforms is in progress, but a backfit SHIPALT for a power distribution upgrade on blocks I/II must be developed and fielded on SSN 774-783. Material lead time is estimated to be less than 12 months.

[P40A / MRO Shock Mod SA 4629K]: MRO Shock Modification (SHIPALT 4620K) - Accomplishes design changes on 20 MROs per ship to meet shock qualification requirement. The MROs are for valves AHP-33, TD-138, DSW-1, DSW-2, TD-128, TD-65, TD-129, SDA-8I, PL-2, SDA-82, TD-127, TD-49, SDA-53, SDA-54, SDA-41, TD-125, PL-81, EAFW-244, EAFW-245 and EAFW-67. Backfit installation of the SHIPALT is planned for SSN 774-781 (782 - 783 received at PSA).

[P40A / Circuit D/Cath Protection Sys OER]: Circuit D /Cathodic Protection System Obsolete Equipment Replacement (OER): Circuit D supports degaussing operations. The current design on block I/II ships is 1990's COTS and is obsolete, requiring tech refresh to block III design via a backfit SHIPALT design and fielding. Additionally, future upgrade of the VA Class SWFTS sonar/fire control systems to TI-16/APB-15 or greater involve a change of middleware from CORBA to Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMPQ), requiring Circuit (CKT) D to also transition to AMPQ. This transition requires a CKT D redesign and upgrade by SHIPALT. The cathodic protection system on VA Class blocks I/II ships uses an Impressed Current Cathodic Protection electronics that is COTS-based. Due to continued obsolescence with in-service ships, a complete system redesign is planned in new construction block V that would require backfit on in-service ships to allow the Impressed Current Cathodic Protection (ICCP) system to continue providing hull structure corrosion protection and maintain interfaces with other systems like CKT D. The redesign effort for the two systems will result in separate SHIPALTS but are related due to system interfaces. Block I/II platforms (SSN 774-783) require upgrade. Change applicability to Block III platforms is under review.

[P40A / SSTG Reliability Upgrades]: Recent failures on in-service VA Class submarines of the SSTG bearing system design have identified the need for both short term and longer term corrective design actions. SHIPALT design development is required for several system improvements including modifications to the Bearing Thrust Housing Chamfer to increase air flow and reduce temperatures, the Bearing Thrust Moisture Sensor to seal sensor internals from moisture and reduce introduction of moisture to the thrust housing, and installation of a Flow Diverter to seal existing gaps between gland seals on the turbine and the forward end of the thrust bearing. These alt designs would be installed by fleet activities and not require headquarters procurement or install funding. Longer term corrective action for block I/II ships (SSN 774-783) involves redesign and possible replacement of bearing system, depending on results of ongoing failure analysis. Impact to Block III platforms is to be determined.

[P40A / Portable Ship Control Unit]: The current Portable Ship's Control Station on VA Class Blocks I and II is obsolete and not supported for spare parts or replacement tablets. This bridge suitcase is used to provide the officer of the deck with electronic chart navigation information and sensor contact information as well as ship's course/speed/rudder indication and related information while underway on the surface. SHIPALT 4776 has previously been developed to install new designed Portable Ship's Control Station (PSCS) systems, and shipsets procured by the VA Class Program Office (PMS450) in BLI 0942 to support installations in FY19 and follow years. Funding in 0941 provides for installation of these units.

[P40A / High Pressure Air Dryer]: HPAD controller components are obsolete and no longer support by the original equipment manufacturer. The replacement HPAD controller is identified but requires non-recurring engineering to build and qualify prototype then develop into a refresh/upgrade alteration with logistic support. Funds procurement for controller upgrades for applicable hulls and to purchase four (4) complete HPADs with upgraded controllers in FY23 to establish an Advanced Equipment Repair Program (AERP) for HPADs for SSN 21/774 Classes.

[P40A / Dry Deck Shelter]: Procures modification efforts required to modernize two of the remaining five DDS over the FYDP per a cost share agreement between Navy and USSOCOM. Funding continues engineering design, fabrication, assembly, acceptance, and testing. Changes include extending the shelter 50 inches, replacing the Track and Cradle assembly with a higher capacity and remotely operated Payload-Launch and Recovery System (P-LARS), incorporation of remote controls for all DDS functions, and relocation of equipment inside the DDS hangar to accommodate Navy and USSOCOM payloads such as SWCS/MK-11 SDV, Large Displacement Unmanned Undersea Vehicle, and a variant of the USSOCOM Dry Combat Submersible.

[P40A / VA Class Acoustic Superiority Prog]: Funding will be utilized to execute requirements included in "PEO SUBMARINES ASW CAMPAIGN PLAN UPDATE, 9073 Ser 450W4K/S0116 of 2 Mar 2016". This letter (SECRET) provides details on the plan to backfit new design Acoustic Superiority (AS) treatment on 5 BLK III submarines during their first Extended Docking Selected Restricted Availability (EDSRA), with follow-on installs on 6 BLK IV submarines during their EDSRAs. In addition, design work for backfit SHIPALT development for selected machinery improvements is included. AS treatment installations will be based on design and material developed for installation on USS SOUTH DAKOTA (SSN 790) as part of the South Dakota Improvement Program (SDIP) during PSA. Beginning in FY18, funding is provided for development of SHIPALT products for backfit installation of the AS treatment by Naval Shipyards on VA Class hulls, as well as for SHIPALT development for backfit of AS-related machinery improvements by EDSRA Shipyards or Fleet Intermediate Maintenance Activities (IMAs). Engineering services are also funded to provide processes and procedures to the EDSRA shipyards for handling, setup and operation of staging enclosures and for the treatment handling and application equipment.

[P40A / Acoustic Range Replacement Equipment]: Procures equipment and materials required to implement and support the military high priority Submarine Silencing Program for operating nuclear submarines. TYCOMs have consistently rated the conduct of noise trials as a high priority funding requirement. The requirements for this program are identified in Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Specific Operational Requirements 46-28 and Naval Sea Systems Instruction (NAVSEAINST) C9073.2B. This is the only program in place to procure equipment for the purpose of measuring, monitoring, assessing and improving the detection capability and reducing the detectability of deployed submarines. The equipment is used on test vessels, listening platforms and at the laboratories. This program replaces or refurbishes broken or obsolete acquisition and analysis hardware and software used to ensure ship's safety; and the execution and completion of acoustic trials objectives identified in CNO SOR 46-28 (assessment of ship's acoustic posture, etc.) and NAVSEAINST C9073.2B (Acoustic Surveys Policy).  These refurbishments and replacements are especially critical in order to maintain the technological advances recently made in the area of acoustic data acquisition under the Acoustic Measurement Facilities Improvement Program and to utilize the South Tongue of the Ocean Acoustic Facility (STAFAC). Specific items include hydrophone arrays, towed arrays, ranging and tracking systems, on-board array electronics, noise sources, shore power cables, data fiber optic cables, data analysis systems, workstations, data storage and retrieval, communications systems, analyzers, tape recorders, accelerometers, monitors, etc.

[P40A / Weapon Launching Handling System]: The Submarine Torpedo Tube Support category funds in-service support and alteration procurements for all submarine Torpedo Tubes (TT), Torpedo Ejection Pumps (TEP), Internal Countermeasure Launchers (ICL), and Weapons Stowage and Handling Systems (WSHS). Development efforts under this item number include Engineering Change Proposals (ECP), ORDALTs, Type Zero (TZ) kits and Test Equipment and alteration material procurement to correct significant deficiencies in equipment affecting personnel safety, ship safety and system performance. Production engineering includes resolving Liaison Action Requests (LARs) configure/test assembly in lab prior to ship installation and in-shop engineering support of vendor testing.

[P40A / SW Class SCS Microprocessor]: SSN HM&E Threshold Modernization - Provides for replacement of SEAWOLF Class Ship Control System Microprocessing unit. The current Ship Control System microprocessors are obsolete and contain electronic components that are no longer support by industry.

[P40A / SW Class SCS Microprocessor]: SEAWOLF Class Ship Control System Microprocessing Unit - This shipalt will replace Seawolf Class submarine ship control processing unit. The ship control processors are obsolete and contain electronic components that are no longer supported by industry.

[P40A / LA/SW Class Design and Shipalt Dev. for SSTG Governors]: Provides for replacement of submarine SSTG Governors on Seawolf Class and Los Angeles Class (MOD 25). The SSTG Governors in these submarines classes are obsolete and contain electronic components that are no longer supported by industry.

[P40A / SSTG MOD 25]: SSTG Mod 25 - Provides for replacement on SSTG Mod 25 Governors on Los Angeles Class submarines. The SSTG Governors in these class of submarines are obsolete and contain electronic
components that are no longer supported by industry.

[P40A / SW Class SSTG Governor]: Provides for replacement on SSTG Governors on SEAWOLF Class submarines. The SSTG Governors in these
class of submarines are obsolete and contain electronic components that are no longer supported by industry.

[P40A / VA Class SOF Modifications]: Starting in FY22, all funding for FY22-25 transferred BLI 0950 to BLI 0941. Provides for procurement of VA Class unique system components that will be installed during planned modernization periods. Also provides funding to perform integrated testing of these unique systems to ensure satisfactory operation with other HM&E and Combat Systems. Funds are provided for procurement of Submarine Special Operations Forces (SOF) unique system components that will be installed during planned modernization periods. Funds are also provided for installation of SOF unique system components.  All funding for FY21 and prior resides in BLI 0950.
[P40A / Diver Oxygen Treatment System (DOTS)/Lockout Trunk]: Funds installation of Diver Oxygen Treatment System (DOTS) and certification of Lockout Trunk (LOT) on Special Operations Forces (SOF) designated submarines SSN 777 and 778 to support NAVY SOCOM requirements.  Supports the planning and procurement of long-lead time materials for installation during scheduled Depot Modernization Periods (DMPs) due to length of time required to install DOTS.

Justification.val: Funding increase from FY20 to FY21 establishes new funding line Diver Oxygen Treatment Sys/Lockout Trunk, Sub Weapons Launch/Handling Production Engineering and funding for the Acoustic Superiority installation planning and staging.

Name.@footnote: Totals shown for SSN Class Component Upgrades (PB002), SEAWOLF Class Hull, Mechanical & Electrical (HM&E) Threshold Modernization (PB007) and SSTG Governors (PB008) are for SHIPALT design documentation and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) product preparation costs.  Facilities/Lab Upgrades (PB004) procures equipment and materials required to implement and support the high priority Submarine Silencing Program for operating Strategic and Attack nuclear submarines.
1.1 & 1.2  Propulsor program provides upgrade to a total of 5 ships and completes in FY21.

1.3 & 1.4  SSTG Digital Voltage Regulator program upgrades a total of 6 ships.  Shipset procurement lead time is two years.  Funding increase from FY20 to FY21 of $4.162M is for the procurement of one (1) shipset for installation in FY23.

1.7 & 1.8  ICS Block 5 Design Change:  Procurement funding begins in FY20 with installs beginning in FY21. This funding profile supports 7 procurements and 6 installs across the FYDP, with remaining procurements and installs outside the FYDP.  Funding increase from FY20 to FY21 of $2.122M is for the first shipboard installation.

1.9 & 1.10  Bulkhead 6 Tile Maintenance ShipAlt 4563K: Procurements have a 1-year lead time. Program funding procures a total of 4 units (additional unit was procured separately by the VA Class program office in FY17) and installs a total of 5 units.

1.11 & 1.12  DGIOTS Shock Modification ShipAlt 4776K:  Procurement and installation occurs in the same year (less than 12-month lead time) executing 2 per year in FYs 19-20, 3 per year in FYs 21-22, and 1 per year in FYs 23-24 for a total of 14 Units.

Name.@footnote: 6.3 New Line - Install Diver Oxygen Treatment System/Lockout Trunk on SSN 777 & 778 funds installation of Diver Oxygen Treatment System (DOTS) and certification of Lockout Trunk (LOT) on Special Operations Forces (SOF) designated submarines SSN 777 and 778 to support NAVY-SOCOM requirements. Funding increase from FY20 to FY21 of $0.957M is for development, planning and procurement necessary to support the shipboard installation in FY22.
Name.val: 6.3) Install Diver Oxygen Treatment System/Lockout Trunk on SSN 777 & 778

Name.@footnote: FY21 funding increase is for the Naval Shipyards (NSY) to develop and procure environmental enclosures with an integrated gantry crane appropriate for NSY drydocks (~$17.1M); procurement of additional handling equipment, lifting fixtures, & acoustic adhesive processing equipment; and installation planning ($5.7M). The cost estimate for environmental enclosure procurement is based on the cost of Electric Boat Corporation's Installation & Access Structure (IAS) used for USS SOUTH DAKOTA Improvement Program (re-use of IAS is not feasible due to differences in EB and NSY drydocks). A total of three environmental enclosures are required to support simultaneous execution of up to three submarine alterations. The first enclosure is planned for procurement in FY21 to meet USS NORTH DAKOTA FY22 availability needs; the second enclosure is planned for FY22/23 procurement to meet USS ILLINOIS FY23 availability needs; and the third enclosure is planned for FY24 procurement to meet USS INDIANA FY25 availability needs. Funding for staging procurement is leveled over FY21-24 to support these need dates.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: VA Acoustic Superiority

Description.val: [VA Acoustic Superiority] PB002 SSN Class Component Upgrades - Virginia Class Acoustic Superiority (AS) - Funding is provided for procurement of AS treatment material for each hull and for installation labor. Material procurement has a 2-year lead time.  Installation is planned during an EDSRA which starts in 4th qtr. FY22 and completes in FY24.
